name: Pullman Cairns International

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights July 2012 and enjoyed our time here. Very pleasant hotel, light and airy with that famously impressive lobby. Even the upper corridors were light and spacious. Room and bathrom a good size and well maintained although no really splashy extras. Nice little balacony - although the wind kept us indoors. Walking distance to the terminal for the day cruises and plenty of restaurants on the harbour, these are located in the ground floors of Harbourlights and Shangri La. Friendly and helpful staff on reception, concierge and tour desks. Very extensive buffet breakfasts hot and cold, although like all hotel breakfast buffets quite expensive, there is alille coffee shop next door that serves breakfast if you want a cheaper option. Did not dine in the main restaurant in the evenings but did have a very satisfactory Bar Meal.
reviews.title: Very Satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a one night stay here arriving late and departing early whilst on our way further north. The hotel staff were all very friendly and we enjoyed our brief stay. The bedrooms and bathrooms were of very good size and were in good condition. The only downside to the hotel was the less good noise insulation between rooms with occasional loud chair scraping noises being audible.
reviews.title: Pleasent hotel with very pleasant staff
a lovely hotel with excellent facilities
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the lobby and entrance to this hotel is absolutely stunning - the pictures on the hotel website don't do it justice at all. It is worth bearing in mind that the bar/restaurant area is located immediately next to the lobby which makes for a very pleasant atmosphere (unlike some hotels where the restaurant is placed in a bland, separate dining room.)
The rooms are spacious and comfortable; it is worthwhile paying the extra for a harbour view.
reviews.title: Nice place in a boring city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here on a girls' weekend/trip away and it's the perfect place for that sort of thing; there's a day spa located within the hotel and the high tea in the bar/lobby is great as well. The pool and spa facilities are superb - again, it's a very spacious area with lots of deckchairs and despite the fact that we were travelling in peak season, it felt peaceful (not crowded at all).
reviews.title: Sebel Cairns July 2012

reviews.text: I've read a number of the reviews on this hotel and can't quite understand what the fuss is all about. This is a typical average tourist hotel with a very large and imposing lobby, but rather simple, functional, though clean rooms. I booked a room that was slightly larger than the normal standard rooms, and there is a small balcony that was rather poorly maintained and the floor was not very clean.
reviews.title: Not sure what all the fuss is about ... Average, decent hotel but unremarkable.

reviews.text: The hotel location is good enough - near enough to the main thoroughfare of Cairns, yet not too crowded and busy outside. It is a short walk to the promenade area where most of the tourists hang out.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Reception staff were not terribly attentive nor efficient. Be careful upon checking out and check your bill carefully. In my case, there was a confusion amongst the staff which was due to poor communication.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay, and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was not what you would expect of a 4 star facility. Limited choices and average to poor quality of food. Service level was also rather wanting.
reviews.title: Would stay there again!

reviews.text: Overall, I'm not sure I would want to come back to this hotel. I was told that the Hilton is generally better, though an older facility. The Shangri-La is also another nice hotel and located right along the waterfront area.
reviews.title: Good value if booked at the right price

reviews.text: We recently used the Sebel for a conference and couldn't be more pleased with the professional way they handled it. The food in particular was excellent and we got a lot of positive feedback from our delegates. The hotel managers were very helpful, professional and responsive. The AV managers (Staging Connections) were also excellent. We couldn't recommend the hotel enough for conferences and events.
reviews.title: Excellent conference venue!

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Sebel Cairns and I could not fault the hotel, staff, amenities and food in any way.... I was that impressed I will be going back with my family again at our first chance. Thankyou Sebel Cairns.... A job well done!!!!
reviews.title: Cairns Best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 25th Wedding Anniversary and we could not have had a better time anywhere in the world. All the staff we encountered within the Sebel were willing to assist us to make our stay more enjoyable. Our requests for assistance were always met with a smile and attended to very efficiently. Our room was spacious, very clean on our arrival and the views at night and in the mornings were spectactular. The food (you must try the High Tea), service and amenities were 1st class and made our stay such a wonderful and unforgettable experience. It has old world charm from the moment you enter the reception area. The Sebel is central to everything without having the feeling of being overcrowded with tourists or just a short walk away from it all.
reviews.title: 25th Wedding Anniversay

reviews.text: A beautiful foyer welcomes the visitor and the helpful desk staff effortlessly had me checked in in five minutes. The room was spacious, well organised and attractive. The bathroom was great, particularly the shower. Nice pool area and deck, good balcony view and reasonably quick lifts. The staff were brilliant. All in all, it was as easy as being at home, but without all the house work.
reviews.title: Fantastic Four Days

reviews.text: Huge well furnished room extra clean.and situated in the heart of Cairns.Top notch sevice and friendly attitude. Only stayed one night - wish it were longer.
reviews.title: LUXURY WITHOUT A HUGE PRICE TAG

reviews.text: The Sebel Cairns is a beautiful grand old hotel. The lobby is light and airy, the staff are pleasant and helpful. The lifts were modern and efficient. Our room was pleasant enough, reasonably spacious and with a nicely appointed marble bathroom with a bath and separate shower. The bed was large and comfortable. It was nice to have our own balcony with views out over the bay. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance of the waterfront and the shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Some room for improvement but good enough

reviews.text: I was disappointed by two things. The first was that some of the furnishings in our room were a bit old and tired. The net curtain had been mended in several places, the framed prints all had that bluish tinge that prints get after a while, and there was a stain on the carpet.
reviews.title: Ok if you don't mind obnoxious management & front desk staff

reviews.text: The second disappointment was the tea and coffee service at breakfast. Actually there was no tea and coffee service, you had to make your own. The cups were very small, and the cappucino machine overflowed the cup every time. The food was great though.
reviews.title: Not too bad, but could be so much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would return to the Sebel Cairns again, I just hope they upgrade their rooms and their tea and coffee service soon.
reviews.title: Return visit to the Sebel

reviews.text: Hotel is in ok locations, has impressive lobby & lovely pool (although in shade so freezing cold this time of year). Rooms are a little dated & tired looking, definitely not 5 star. I found bedding uncomfortable. There is no in room heating, air con only cools so it was rather unpleasant as it was very cold & we sat with our jackets on. But worst about this hotel is the attitude of the front desk staff, they were so unfriendly & rediculous that we checked out early just to get away from this unfriendly place. A real shame & not what I would have expected from a Sebel hotel.
reviews.title: Top value and service

description: Impressive 16-story Hotel with extensive use of local marble & timber.
